meanings.definition: Layers of sediment deposited in a lake or reservoir annually.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the varves to learn about the history of the lake.
meanings.sent2: The varves in the lake show different layers of sediment over time.
meanings.sent3: The varves in the lake told a story of the changing seasons each year.
meanings.sent4: The varves were like pages in a book, revealing the past of the lake.
meanings.sent5: I could see the varves clearly, like colorful stripes on a canvas.

meanings.definition: To form or deposit in distinct layers.
meanings.sent1: The river varves the soil as it flows downstream.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the wind varves the sand dunes into beautiful patterns.
meanings.sent3: I tried to varve the cake layers neatly, but they ended up crooked.
meanings.sent4: Her words varved layers of meaning into my heart.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully varves paint onto the canvas, creating a masterpiece.
